title: Ticket #5031: DaemonCore::CreateProcess ASSERT empty InfoCommandSinfulStringMyself
description:
I added the assert in [27857] (2227b5625331d8c0908a6583c4888c30a2a3d468) because it would

DaemonCore::CreateProcess creates the environment variable CONDOR_INHERIT with a bunch of useful stuff for its child process to use. One of these values is teh parent processes's command port, obtained using InfoCommandSinfulStringMyself. However, ICSSM returns an empty string if it can't determine its own command port. If the sinful returned by ICSSM is empty, the resulting CONDOR_INHERIT environment variable has invalid data; a child process trying to read it will encounter cryptic errors. Bugs cause ICSSM to return an empty string when it shouldn't have happened; ex. #2538 #2216. Thus, in [27857] (Git b671a019), I added an ASSERT on the theory that we should never generate an invalid CONDOR_INHERIT. Having such an ASSERT would have sped up debugging for the above two tickets.

However, if the parent process legitimately doesn't have a command port (say, DAGMan started with "-p 0", see #4987), ICSSM will legitimately return an empty string. Such a process should still be able to DaemonCore::CreateProcess.

Something needs to be done. In the short term the ASSERT will be removed, but it, or something like it, should be re-added. Options I see:

  • Leave the ASSERT gone. Cons: removes a debugging tool that I have wished already existed.
  • Replace the ASSERT with a dprintf. Cons: Spams innocent logs, likely overlooked in guilty logs
  • Way back in dc_main, squirrel away command_port in a global; if it's 0 we Do Something Else.
  • In DaemonCore::CreateProcess, assume that if want_command_port is false, we can safely Do Something Else. (Are there any cases where we don't want the command port but do want to inherit things from our parent?)

"Do Something Else" adds another question:

  • Skip the ASSERT and hope no one looks at CONDOR_INHERIT?
  • Skip the ASSERT and trash inheritbuf before anyone uses it?
  • Have all code setting inheritbuf wrapped in a test if(Do Something Else)?

You can reproduce this case (no command port, calls CreateProcess) in two different ways: 

condor_submit_dag -f -no_submit job_dagman_basic.dag
edit job_dagman_basic.dag.condor.sub and prepend '-p 0' to the arguments
condor_submit job_dagman_basic.dag.condor.sub

or 

./condor_install --make-personal-condor
condor_master -f -p 0
